pages.text:
About Us
Highland Lakes is a gated, 55+ community situated in Central Florida just south of Leesburg.  Our community resides in a beautiful location with several small lakes, natural wetlands, and open grounds that enable our homeowners to observe the wonderful local wildlife.  We are near the Florida Turnpike granting easy access to Orlando airport and other tourist attractions but far enough away to enjoy the quiet natural surroundings.  Residents enjoy the serenity, along with benefit from peace of mind with their gated access.
Highland Lakes consists of 938 homes and villas with a recreational clubhouse that includes a large arena, exercise room, library, kitchen, billiard room, craft room, and meeting rooms. The community also provides a variety of amenities for its homeowners such as indoor (heated) and outdoor pools, tennis courts, pickleball courts, shuffleboard courts, bocce ball courts, horseshoe pits, picnic pavilion, nature trail, golf driving range, free RV and boat storage, wood crafters building and softball field.  Also, there are over fifty activities and committees to choose from, allowing residents to become as active and involved with their community as they like.
Our Property Owners Association is governed by a Board of Directors, elected annually by the homeowners. The Association is financially sound and maintains sufficient reserve accounts insuring common grounds and facilities have funds available for upkeep and replacement to keep Highland Lakes beautiful.
There are several pages and links on our website, under Community, for browsing that will allow you to become familiar with Highland Lakes and all we have to offer.

Contact Us
For Community or BOD issues please fill out and submit the form on the right.
Estoppel requests can best be fulfilled by clicking on the below link to reach our community's Management Company:
https://www.closingsdocsnow.com/
Penny Myers, CAM
pmyers@lelandmanagement.com
CAM Office Phone     352-365-1457 (Fax) 352-365-6701
Leland Emergency Number: (866) 263-3987
The responsibilities of a Community Association Manager are as follows
:
Provide administrative support and guidance to the Board of Directors, in assisting with coordination of Board and Membership Meetings, record keeping, and communications.
Enforcement of the Association's rules and regulations as dictated by the governing documents and promulgated by your Board of Directors.
Oversight of vendors hired by the Association for contractual obligation compliance.
Other duties as specified by the Board of Directors or outlined in the Association's management contract to support the operations of the Association.
Your Community Association Manager and Leland Management's dedicated support staff office hours are typically Monday through Friday from 9 am to 5 pm excluding holidays.
